info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 11 at 11:07AM CDT until June 18 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in New Orleans LA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Mississippi...Louisiana...
Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting Washington Parish and Pearl River County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Pearl River near Bogalusa.
* WHEN...From Sunday morning to Wednesday, June 18.
* IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Woodlands and crop acreage along the river will be flooded. The Bogue Chitto Wildlife Management area will be inundated with water in recreational camps and over access roads.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Sunday morning to a crest of 19.0 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday, June 18. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 315 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO WEDNESDAY, JUNE 18
